snippet: In Albany, some legislators say they are open to changing state law to allow only parents to see the evaluations of their children’s educators.
abstract: Some lawmakers in Albany say that they are open to changing state law to allow parents to see the evaluations of their children's teachers, but to block the general public from having access to those reports; New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg supports public access to reports, but critics question accuracy of evaluations and effect of making them public.
lead_paragraph: In Albany, some legislators say they are open to changing state law to allow only parents to see the evaluations of their children’s educators.

headline.seo: New York Legislature to Weigh Limiting Access to Teacher Rankings
headline.main: Release of City Teachers’ Rankings Prompts Lawmakers to Weigh Limiting Access
headline.print_headline: After Release of City Teachers’ Rankings, State Lawmakers Weigh Limiting Access
